medical_questions.what is menstruation?: Menstruation, or a period, is the monthly shedding of the uterine lining when pregnancy does not occur.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of a fever?: Symptoms include elevated body temperature, chills, sweating, headache, and body aches.
medical_questions.What is hypertension?: Hypertension is high blood pressure, a condition that increases the risk of heart disease and stroke.
medical_questions.What are the causes of diabetes?: Causes include genetic factors, obesity, lack of exercise, and an unhealthy diet.
medical_questions.How do vaccines work?: Vaccines stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies, preparing the body to fight specific infections.
medical_questions.What is the normal range for blood press: The normal range is typically around 120/80 mmHg.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of a heart attack?: Symptoms include chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea, and sweating.
medical_questions.What is anemia?: Anemia is a condition where the blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells to carry oxygen.
medical_questions.What causes asthma?: Asthma is caused by inflammation and narrowing of the airways, often triggered by allergens or irritants.
medical_questions.How can I prevent flu?: Prevent flu by getting vaccinated, washing hands frequently, and avoiding close contact with sick individuals.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of COVID-19?: Symptoms include fever, cough, loss of taste or smell, fatigue, and difficulty breathing.
medical_questions.What is osteoporosis?: Osteoporosis is a condition where bones become weak and brittle, increasing the risk of fractures.
medical_questions.What is the treatment for migraines?: Treatments include pain relievers, preventive medications, lifestyle changes, and avoiding triggers.
medical_questions.What is cholesterol?: Cholesterol is a waxy substance in the blood, essential for cell function but harmful in excess.
medical_questions.What is a stroke?: A stroke occurs when blood supply to the brain is interrupted, leading to brain cell damage.
medical_questions.What is arthritis?: Arthritis is inflammation of joints, causing pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility.
medical_questions.What causes obesity?: Obesity is caused by excessive calorie intake, lack of exercise, genetics, and hormonal imbalances.
medical_questions.What is a balanced diet?: A balanced diet includes a variety of foods providing carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, and minerals.
medical_questions.What is a UTI?: A urinary tract infection (UTI) is an infection in any part of the urinary system, usually caused by bacteria.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of pneumonia?: Symptoms include cough, fever, chills, shortness of breath, and chest pain.
medical_questions.What is hepatitis?: Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver, often caused by viruses, alcohol, or toxins.
medical_questions.What is an allergic reaction?: An allergic reaction is the immune system's response to a harmless substance, causing symptoms like rashes, itching, and swelling.
medical_questions.What causes indigestion?: Indigestion is caused by overeating, spicy foods, stress, or underlying conditions like ulcers.
medical_questions.What is insomnia?: Insomnia is a sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
medical_questions.How can I manage stress?: Manage stress through relaxation techniques, exercise, adequate sleep, and time management.
medical_questions.What is malaria?: Malaria is a disease caused by parasites transmitted through the bites of infected mosquitoes.
medical_questions.What is cancer?: Cancer is a group of diseases involving abnormal cell growth that can invade or spread to other parts of the body.
medical_questions.What are the benefits of drinking water?: Drinking water helps maintain hydration, supports organ function, and regulates body temperature.
medical_questions.What is CPR?: Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) is a life-saving technique used in emergencies to restore breathing and circulation.
medical_questions.What is tuberculosis?: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection that mainly affects the lungs but can spread to other organs.
medical_questions.What is a healthy BMI range?: A healthy BMI range is typically between 18.5 and 24.9.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of anemia?: Symptoms include fatigue, pale skin, shortness of breath, dizziness, and cold hands or feet.
medical_questions.What is eczema?: Eczema is a skin condition causing red, itchy, and inflamed patches of skin.
medical_questions.What are the causes of heart disease?: Causes include high blood pressure, high cholesterol, smoking, obesity, and diabetes.
medical_questions.What is the flu?: The flu is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
medical_questions.What is CPR used for?: CPR is used to revive someone whose heart has stopped or who is not breathing.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of jaundice?: Symptoms include yellowing of the skin and eyes, dark urine, and pale stools.
medical_questions.What is a vaccine?: A vaccine is a biological preparation that provides immunity against specific diseases.
medical_questions.What is an autoimmune disease?: An autoimmune disease occurs when the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own tissues.
medical_questions.What is Parkinson's disease?: Parkinson's disease is a neurodegenerative disorder affecting movement and coordination.
medical_questions.What is the role of fiber in the diet?: Fiber aids digestion, prevents constipation, and supports heart health.
medical_questions.What causes kidney stones?: Kidney stones are caused by the crystallization of minerals and salts in the urine.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of a stroke?: Symptoms include sudden numbness or weakness, confusion, trouble speaking, and loss of balance.
medical_questions.What is hyperthyroidism?: Hyperthyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone.
medical_questions.What are the benefits of regular exercis: Exercise improves cardiovascular health, boosts mood, strengthens muscles, and aids weight management.
medical_questions.What causes ulcers?: Ulcers are caused by H. pylori bacteria, excessive NSAID use, or stress.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of appendicitis?: Symptoms include severe abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and fever.
medical_questions.What is the function of the liver?: The liver processes nutrients, detoxifies the blood, and produces bile for digestion.
medical_questions.What are the signs of depression?: Signs include persistent sadness, loss of interest, fatigue, and changes in appetite or sleep patterns.
medical_questions.What is epilepsy?: Epilepsy is a neurological condition characterized by recurrent seizures.
medical_questions.What is the function of the pancreas?: The pancreas produces insulin and enzymes that aid in digestion.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of food poisoning?: Symptoms include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and stomach cramps.
medical_questions.What is the common treatment for allergi: Common treatments include antihistamines, decongestants, and avoiding allergens.
medical_questions.What is the role of protein in the body?: Protein helps build and repair tissues, produces enzymes, and supports immune function.
medical_questions.What is GERD?: GERD (Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease) is a condition where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus.
medical_questions.What are the signs of dehydration in chi: Signs include dry mouth, lack of tears, sunken eyes, and decreased urination.
medical_questions.What is HIV?: HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) attacks the immune system, leading to AIDS if untreated.
medical_questions.What causes back pain?: Causes include poor posture, muscle strain, herniated discs, or arthritis.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of meningitis?: Symptoms include fever, headache, stiff neck, sensitivity to light, and confusion.
medical_questions.What is the role of iron in the body?: Iron helps in the production of hemoglobin, which carries oxygen in the blood.
medical_questions.What is a cataract?: A cataract is a clouding of the eye's lens, leading to vision impairment.
medical_questions.What are the symptoms of Lyme disease?: Symptoms include a bullseye-shaped rash, fever, fatigue, and joint pain.

medical_questions.What causes hiccups?: Hiccups are caused by involuntary contractions of the diaphragm, often triggered by overeating or carbonated drinks.

medical_questions.What is a hernia?: A hernia occurs when an organ pushes through a weak spot in the surrounding muscle or tissue.
medical_questions.What is the role of vitamin C?: Vitamin C supports the immune system, helps with wound healing, and acts as an antioxidant.

medical_questions.what are the symptoms of menstruation?: Symptoms include abdominal cramps, bloating, mood swings, headaches, and fatigue.
medical_questions.what is PMS (premenstrual syndrome)?: PMS refers to physical and emotional symptoms occurring before menstruation, such as mood swings, bloating, and headaches.
medical_questions.how can I relieve period cramps?: Period cramps can be relieved with heat therapy, gentle exercise, hydration, pain relievers, and relaxation techniques.
medical_questions.what is an irregular period?: Irregular periods refer to cycles that vary in length, often due to hormonal imbalances, stress, or medical conditions.
medical_questions.what causes heavy periods?: Heavy periods can be caused by hormonal imbalances, fibroids, endometriosis, or certain medications.
medical_questions.how long does a normal period last?: A normal period typically lasts 3 to 7 days, though variations exist.
medical_questions.what is endometriosis?: Endometriosis is a condition where tissue similar to the uterine lining grows outside the uterus, causing pain and heavy periods.
medical_questions.what is PCOS (polycystic ovary syndrome): PCOS is a hormonal disorder causing irregular periods, weight gain, and ovarian cysts.
medical_questions.how is PCOS treated?: PCOS is managed with lifestyle changes, hormonal therapy, and medications.
medical_questions.can stress affect my period?: Yes, stress can disrupt hormone levels, leading to delayed or missed periods.
medical_questions.why do I get acne before my period?: Hormonal fluctuations before menstruation can trigger increased oil production, leading to acne.
medical_questions.what is blood type?: Blood type is a group of four different blood cells that are inherited from parents and can be determined by a test called a blood type test.
medical_questions.how do blood types affect genetic inheri: Blood type plays a crucial role in determining the traits that will be passed on to the next generation.
medical_questions.what is influenza (flu)?: Influenza is a viral infection that affects the respiratory system, causing fever, cough, and body aches.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of influenza?: Symptoms include cough, sore throat, runny nose, headache, and muscle pain.
medical_questions.what is periods?: Periods, or menstruation, are the monthly shedding of the uterine lining when pregnancy does not occur. This process is regulated by hormonal changes and typically lasts 3 to 7 days.
medical_questions.how is influenza treated?: Treatment includes antiviral drugs like fluconazole or zinc supplements.
medical_questions.what is COVID-19?: COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of COVID-19?: Symptoms include fever, cough, shortness of breath, loss of taste or smell, and fatigue.
medical_questions.how is COVID-19 treated?: Treatment depends on severity, including rest, hydration, antiviral drugs, and hospitalization if necessary.
medical_questions.what is bronchitis?: Bronchitis is the inflammation of the bronchial tubes, causing coughing and mucus production.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of bronchitis?: Symptoms include persistent cough, chest discomfort, mucus production, and shortness of breath.
medical_questions.how is bronchitis treated?: Treatment includes rest, hydration, cough suppressants, and avoiding smoke or pollutants.
medical_questions.what is sinusitis?: Sinusitis is the inflammation of the sinuses, often caused by infections or allergies.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of sinusitis?: Symptoms include facial pain, nasal congestion, headache, and a runny nose.
medical_questions.how is sinusitis treated?: Treatment includes steam inhalation, saline nasal sprays, and sometimes antibiotics.
medical_questions.what is tonsillitis?: Tonsillitis is the inflammation of the tonsils, usually caused by a viral or bacterial infection.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of tonsillitis?: Symptoms include sore throat, swollen tonsils, fever, and difficulty swallowing.
medical_questions.how is tonsillitis treated?: Treatment includes rest, warm salt water gargles, and antibiotics if bacterial.
medical_questions.what is appendicitis?: Appendicitis is the inflammation of the appendix, often requiring emergency surgery.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of appendicitis?: Severe abdominal pain (lower right side), nausea, fever, and loss of appetite.
medical_questions.what is a peptic ulcer?: A peptic ulcer is a sore in the stomach lining caused by excess acid or bacterial infection.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of a peptic ulcer?: Symptoms include burning stomach pain, bloating, nausea, and heartburn.
medical_questions.how is a peptic ulcer treated?: Treatment includes antacids, antibiotics (for H. pylori), and avoiding spicy foods.
medical_questions.what is GERD (acid reflux)?: GERD is a digestive disorder where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing heartburn.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of GERD?: Symptoms include bloating, gasping, difficulty swallowing, and nausea.
medical_questions.how is GERD treated?: Treatment includes medications, surgery, and lifestyle changes to control the disease.
medical_questions.what is irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)?: IBS is a gastrointestinal disorder causing abdominal pain, bloating, and irregular bowel movements.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of IBS?: Symptoms include cramping, diarrhea, constipation, and bloating.
medical_questions.how is IBS treated?: Treatment includes dietary changes, stress management, and medications.
medical_questions.what is Crohn's disease?: Crohn's disease is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) affecting the digestive tract.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of Crohn's disease: Symptoms include abdominal pain, diarrhea, weight loss, and fatigue.
medical_questions.how is Crohn's disease treated?: Treatment includes anti-inflammatory medications, dietary adjustments, and sometimes surgery.
medical_questions.what is celiac disease?: Celiac disease is an autoimmune disorder where consuming gluten damages the small intestine.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of celiac disease?: Symptoms include diarrhea, weight loss, bloating, and fatigue.
medical_questions.how is celiac disease treated?: Treatment involves a strict gluten-free diet.
medical_questions.what is lactose intolerance?: Lactose intolerance is the inability to digest lactose, a sugar found in dairy products.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of lactose intoler: Symptoms include bloating, diarrhea, stomach cramps, and gas after consuming dairy.
medical_questions.how is lactose intolerance managed?: Avoiding dairy or using lactase enzyme supplements can help.
medical_questions.what is urinary tract infection (UTI)?: A UTI is a bacterial infection affecting the urinary system, including the bladder and urethra.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of UTI?: Symptoms include burning during urination, frequent urination, and lower abdominal pain.
medical_questions.how is a UTI treated?: Treatment includes antibiotics and drinking plenty of fluids.
medical_questions.what is kidney stone disease?: Kidney stones are hard deposits of minerals that form in the kidneys and cause pain.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of kidney stones?: Symptoms include severe back or abdominal pain, blood in urine, and nausea.
medical_questions.how are kidney stones treated?: Treatment includes drinking plenty of fluids, pain management, and sometimes surgery.
medical_questions.what is hypothyroidism?: Hypothyroidism is a condition where the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough hormones.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of hypothyroidism?: Weight gain, fatigue, dry skin, cold intolerance, and slow heart rate.
medical_questions.how is hypothyroidism treated?: Taking thyroid hormone replacement therapy and eating iodine-rich foods.
medical_questions.what is hyperthyroidism?: Hyperthyroidism is when the thyroid gland produces too much hormone, speeding up metabolism.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of hyperthyroidism: Weight loss, rapid heartbeat, anxiety, tremors, and excessive sweating.
medical_questions.how is hyperthyroidism treated?: Medication, radioactive iodine therapy, or thyroid surgery.
medical_questions.what is depression?: Depression is a mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of depression?: Symptoms include low energy, sadness, lack of motivation, and sleep disturbances.
medical_questions.how is depression treated?: Treatment includes therapy, medication, lifestyle changes, and support groups.
medical_questions.what is anxiety disorder?: Anxiety disorder is a mental health condition causing excessive worry and fear.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of anxiety?: Symptoms include nervousness, rapid heartbeat, restlessness, and panic attacks.
medical_questions.how is anxiety treated?: Treatment includes therapy, relaxation techniques, and medication if necessary.
medical_questions.what is insomnia?: Insomnia is a sleep disorder causing difficulty falling or staying asleep.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of insomnia?: Symptoms include difficulty sleeping, fatigue, irritability, and poor concentration.
medical_questions.how is insomnia treated?: Treatment includes sleep hygiene, cognitive therapy, and sometimes medication.
medical_questions.what is Alzheimer's disease?: Alzheimer's is a progressive brain disorder that causes memory loss and cognitive decline.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of Alzheimer's dis: Symptoms include memory loss, confusion, difficulty speaking, and personality changes.
medical_questions.how is Alzheimer's disease treated?: There is no cure, but medications and therapies can slow progression.
medical_questions.what is Parkinson's disease?: Parkinson's is a neurological disorder affecting movement and coordination.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of Parkinson's dis: Symptoms include tremors, stiffness, slow movement, and balance problems.
medical_questions.how is Parkinson's disease treated?: Medications, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery (deep brain stimulation).
medical_questions.what is cystic fibrosis?: Cystic fibrosis is a chronic lung disease caused by a buildup of fibrosis in the lungs.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of cystic fibrosis: Symptoms include shortness of breath, chest pain, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_questions.how is cystic fibrosis treated?: Treatment includes medications, surgery, and sometimes lifestyle changes.
medical_questions.what is rheumatoid arthritis?: Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic joint disease caused by inflammation and weakening of collagen fibers.
medical_questions.what is anemia?: Anemia is a condition where the body lacks enough healthy red blood cells to carry oxygen efficiently.
medical_questions.what is atherosclerosis?: Atherosclerosis is a condition where plaque builds up
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of atherosclerosis: Symptoms include high blood pressure, pain, and discomfort in the arms and legs.
medical_questions.how is atherosclerosis treated?: Treatment includes medications, surgery, and lifestyle changes to reduce the risk of developing stroke.
medical_questions.what is hypertension?: Hypertension is a blood pressure that's too high.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of hypertension?: Symptoms include high blood pressure, dizziness, rapid heartbeat, and shortness of breath.
medical_questions.how is hypertension treated?: Treatment includes medications, medication therapy, or surgery to reduce blood pressure.
medical_questions.what is diabetes?: Diabetes is a metabolic disorder where blood sugar levels become too high due to insulin issues.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of diabetes?: Increased thirst, frequent urination, unexplained weight loss, fatigue, and blurred vision.
medical_questions.how is diabetes treated?: Treatment involves insulin, medication, dietary changes, and regular exercise.
medical_questions.what is arthritis?: Arthritis is inflammation of the joints, causing pain and stiffness.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of arthritis?: Symptoms include joint pain, swelling, stiffness, and reduced mobility.
medical_questions.how is arthritis treated?: Treatment includes medications, physical therapy, lifestyle changes, and sometimes surgery.
medical_questions.what is cancer?: Cancer is the uncontrolled growth of abnormal cells in the body.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of cancer?: Symptoms include pain, redness, swelling, and abnormal cell growth.
medical_questions.how is cancer treated?: Treatment options include chemotherapy, radiation, surgery, and targeted therapies.
medical_questions.what is osteoporosis?: Osteoporosis is a condition where bones become weak and brittle.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of osteoporosis?: Symptoms include back pain, loss of height, and fractures.
medical_questions.how is osteoporosis treated?: Treatment includes calcium and vitamin D supplements, weight-bearing exercises, and medications.
medical_questions.what is gastroesophageal reflux disease: GERD is a condition that causes gas to enter the stomach and cause bloating, gasping, and difficulty swallowing.
medical_questions.what is pneumonia?: Pneumonia is a lung infection causing inflammation in the air sacs.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of pneumonia?: Cough, fever, chills, chest pain, and difficulty breathing.
medical_questions.how is pneumonia treated?: Antibiotics for bacterial pneumonia, rest, fluids, and fever-reducing medications.
medical_questions.what is dengue?: Dengue is a mosquito-borne disease caused by the dengue virus.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of dengue?: Symptoms include fever, cough, sore throat, headache, and muscle pain.
medical_questions.how is dengue treated?: Supportive care, hydration, pain relievers, and monitoring for complications.
medical_questions.what is influenza?: Influenza is a viral infection caused by the influenza virus.
medical_questions.what is polio?: Polio is a viral infection caused by the poliovirus.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of polio?: Symptoms include fever, sore throat, headache, muscle pain, and severe weakness.
medical_questions.how is polio treated?: Polio is treated with antiviral drugs like fluconazole or zinc supplements.
medical_questions.what is HIV/AIDS?: HIV/AIDS is a disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and its associated antiretroviral therapy (ART).
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of HIV/AIDS?: Symptoms include symptoms of AIDS, such as high blood pressure, diarrhea, and loss of appetite.
medical_questions.how is HIV/AIDS treated?: HIV/AIDS is treated with antiretroviral drugs like fluconazole or zinc supplements, as well as medications for managing side effects.
medical_questions.what is tuberculosis?: Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial infection affecting the lungs, caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of anemia?: Symptoms include fatigue, pale skin, shortness of breath, dizziness, and weakness.
medical_questions.how is anemia treated?: Anemia is treated with iron supplements, dietary changes, and addressing underlying causes.
medical_questions.what is malaria?: Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease caused by Plasmodium parasites, leading to fever and chills.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of malaria?: Malaria symptoms include fever, chills, sweating, headaches, nausea, vomiting, and muscle pain.
medical_questions.how is malaria treated?: Malaria is treated with antimalarial medications such as chloroquine, artemisinin-based therapies, and supportive care.
medical_questions.what is a heart attack?: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked, often due to clogged arteries.
medical_questions.what are the early signs of a heart atta: Chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea, dizziness, and pain in the arms, neck, or jaw.
medical_questions.how is a heart attack treated?: Treatment includes medications, angioplasty, or bypass surgery to restore blood flow.
medical_questions.what is high blood pressure?: High blood pressure (hypertension) is a condition where the force of blood against artery walls is too high.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of high blood pres: Often no symptoms, but it can cause headaches, dizziness, and nosebleeds in severe cases.
medical_questions.how do I lower high blood pressure?: Lower salt intake, exercise regularly, eat potassium-rich foods, and manage stress.
medical_questions.what is asthma?: Asthma is a chronic condition causing airway inflammation and breathing difficulty.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of asthma?: Shortness of breath, wheezing, chest tightness, and frequent coughing.
medical_questions.how is asthma treated?: Using inhalers, avoiding triggers, and taking prescribed medications like bronchodilators.
medical_questions.what is kidney disease?: Kidney disease occurs when the kidneys lose their ability to filter waste properly.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of kidney disease?: Symptoms include swelling, fatigue, dark urine, high blood pressure, and nausea.
medical_questions.how is kidney disease treated?: Treatment involves medications, dialysis, or kidney transplant in severe cases.
medical_questions.what are the early signs of cancer?: Unexplained weight loss, persistent fatigue, unusual lumps, and changes in skin or moles.
medical_questions.what is a stroke?: A stroke occurs when blood supply to the brain is blocked or a blood vessel bursts.
medical_questions.how do I recognize a stroke?: FAST (Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call emergency services).
medical_questions.how is a stroke treated?: Emergency treatment includes clot-busting drugs, surgery, and rehabilitation therapy.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of tuberculosis?: Persistent cough, night sweats, weight loss, fever, and chest pain.
medical_questions.how is tuberculosis treated?: A long course of antibiotics, usually lasting 6-9 months.
medical_questions.what is dengue fever?: Dengue fever is a viral infection spread by mosquitoes, causing high fever and severe body aches.
medical_questions.what are the symptoms of dengue fever?: High fever, severe headaches, joint pain, rashes, and bleeding gums.
medical_questions.how is dengue fever treated?: There is no specific cure; treatment focuses on hydration, pain relief, and monitoring for complications.

medical_questions.what are the benefits of regular exercis: Regular exercise improves cardiovascular health, strengthens muscles, boosts mood, and helps maintain a healthy weight.

medical_questions.can exercise help reduce stress and anxi: Yes, physical activity releases endorphins, which improve mood and reduce stress and anxiety levels.

medical_questions.what are some low-impact exercises for j: Swimming, cycling, yoga, and elliptical training are good low-impact options that reduce strain on joints.
medical_questions.is walking enough exercise for good heal: Yes, brisk walking for at least 30 minutes a day can improve heart health, aid weight loss, and boost mental well-being.
medical_questions.how can I build muscle effectively?: Strength training with progressive overload, a protein-rich diet, and proper rest are essential for muscle growth.
medical_questions.what are the risks of over-exercising?: Over-exercising can lead to fatigue, injuries, weakened immunity, and hormonal imbalances.
medical_questions.how does hydration affect exercise perfo: Proper hydration prevents fatigue, improves endurance, and supports muscle function during workouts.
